name: Vegan Zucchini Bread
description: You will love this vegan zucchini bread with walnuts and chocolate chips. It's moist, fluffy, and super easy to make! It makes a great snack or breakfast recipe that doesn't require much work!
recipeIngredient: 1/4 cup canola oil or melted coconut oil
1/4 cup coconut sugar or brown sugar
1/3 cup dark chocolate chips (make sure they're vegan)

recipeInstructions.text: Grate the zucchini either in a food processor or with a handheld grater. Then throughly squeeze them with your hands to remove as much excess water as possible.
recipeInstructions.name: Grate the zucchini either in a food processor or with a handheld grater. Then throughly squeeze them with your hands to remove as much excess water as possible.

recipeInstructions.text: Combine the dry ingredients in a bowl. Preheat your oven to 350 °F.
recipeInstructions.name: Combine the dry ingredients in a bowl. Preheat your oven to 350 °F.

recipeInstructions.text: Then add the mashed banana, the apple sauce, the maple syrup, the oil, and the vanilla extract. Stir until combined. Then add the grated zucchini and stir quickly.
recipeInstructions.name: Then add the mashed banana, the apple sauce, the maple syrup, the oil, and the vanilla extract. Stir until combined. Then add the grated zucchini and stir quickly.

recipeInstructions.text: Next, mix in the chopped walnuts and the dark chocolate chips. Make sure not to overmix the batter as this can cause the zucchini bread to not rise properly
recipeInstructions.name: Next, mix in the chopped walnuts and the dark chocolate chips. Make sure not to overmix the batter as this can cause the zucchini bread to not rise properly

recipeInstructions.text: Line a loaf pan with parchment paper (let the parchment paper overlap the loaf pan) and pour the vegan zucchini bread batter into the loaf pan.
recipeInstructions.name: Line a loaf pan with parchment paper (let the parchment paper overlap the loaf pan) and pour the vegan zucchini bread batter into the loaf pan.

recipeInstructions.text: Bake your zucchini bread for 40-50 minutes. Do a toothpick test to check if the zucchini bread is done. Just stick a toothpick into the center of your zucchini bread. If there is wet batter on the toothpick, it needs more time. But if it comes out clean, it's done.
recipeInstructions.name: Bake your zucchini bread for 40-50 minutes. Do a toothpick test to check if the zucchini bread is done. Just stick a toothpick into the center of your zucchini bread. If there is wet batter on the toothpick, it needs more time. But if it comes out clean, it's done.

recipeInstructions.text: Let the zucchini bread cool down in the loaf pan for about 20 minutes before moving it to a cooling rack. If you take it out too early, it might break apart.
recipeInstructions.name: Let the zucchini bread cool down in the loaf pan for about 20 minutes before moving it to a cooling rack. If you take it out too early, it might break apart.

keywords: how to make vegan zucchini bread, vegan zucchini bread, vegan zucchini bread recipe
